name: The Shaw House Bed and Breakfast

reviews.text: Yes, it's cluttered and there's no separate guest spot. But I stayed here before coming to live in Georgetown for a time, and Mary and Joe could not have been sweeter. Totally interested in me and my life, they did seem like a new elderly Southern aunt and uncle. I ended up settling in the neighborhood and Mary came to shop our yard sale. She told me all about her children and their life, and was perfectly happy for me to get my binoculars and bird watch the marsh that fronts their home.
reviews.title: Y'all have a good view of this mom and pop home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, en fin, for Souther hospitality, y'all can't beat the Shaw House. If you want a fancy breakfast and uncluttered surroundings, find a different place in G'town.
reviews.title: Southern Hospitality

reviews.text: Charming place, wonderful hosts. Amazing view and walking distance to the historic waterfront. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Depends on what you are looking for?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I felt exactly like I was visiting my aunt and uncle. The aunt and uncle who loved me; were always glad to see me and made me feel at home. The ones who always had time to sit down, talk and spend time with me. The same ones who had the time to spend with me because they let their house go! If you want to visit with the wonderful, aging, sight impaired inn keepers, in their home, this is the place for you! If you want a well run, dusted, cleaned, clutter free B& B, with a decent breakfast you better keep looking! The bed was clean, I think, and comfortable, but take your own clean pillow and just have coffee for breakfast.
reviews.title: A bit less than we expected

reviews.text: View of the old rice fields from the large screened in porch is breath taking!
reviews.title: Amazing View
